text:
There:
https://www.linkedin.com/posts/karl-wester-ebbinghaus-a41507153_mvpbuzz-ripsmb1-smb1-activity-7159293758537146368-QB4p/
 
Content: 
“Oh well, SMB1. 
If you reframe the word printing nightmare, just don't think about the known
CVE. 
Think about the millions of printers and MFPs being attached to production
networks. Or even yours. 
- firmware never patched 
- (Rouge) unmanaged LPT / USB to LAN printservers still exist 
- printers having (unrestricted) internet access 
- SMB 1 enabled for the sake of scanning documents and sorts 
- no firmware available to switch on SMB2 or newer. 
- Accessing LDAP without encyption for ease of use. 
What can you do? 
End your Printing Nightmare! 
Secure your network 
Establish printing VLANs 
Disable SMB1, Enable LDAPs 
Disable the tons of unrequired protocols that come enabled by default 
Consider the use of secure SNMP if needed. 
Disable Spooler Services where not needed by default. 
Use more modern v4 or MOPRIA/IPP drivers 
If your vendor doesn't allow it: 
Search for better ones. There exist vendors that care more about their printing
machines they are selling and security. 
In this posting I am not even talking about other vectors like securing printed
output. 
Another day another challenge.” 
Best regards, 
Florian Stosse 
Cybersecurity engineer

metadata.topic: RE: A Practical Guide to PrintNightmare in 2024
